questions.question_text: What do we get from cereals, pulses, fruits and vegetables?
hints: Recall the nutritional components provided by each food group
Think about carbohydrates, proteins, vitamins, and minerals

questions.question_text: How do biotic and abiotic factors affect crop production?
hints: Define biotic and abiotic factors
Consider diseases, pests, weather conditions, and soil quality

questions.question_text: What are the desirable agronomic characteristics for crop improvements?
hints: Think about plant height, branching, maturity duration
Consider resistance to stresses and adaptability

questions.question_text: What are macro-nutrients and why are they called macro-nutrients?
hints: Define macro-nutrients based on quantity required
List examples like nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium

questions.question_text: How do plants get nutrients?
hints: Consider sources: air, water, soil
Think about absorption through roots and leaves

questions.question_text: Compare the use of manure and fertilizers in maintaining soil fertility.
hints: List advantages and disadvantages of each
Consider long-term vs short-term effects
Think about environmental impact

questions.question_text: Which of the following conditions will give the most benefits? Why? (a) Farmers use high-quality seeds, do not adopt irrigation or use fertilizers. (b) Farmers use ordinary seeds, adopt irrigation and use fertilizer. (c) Farmers use quality seeds, adopt irrigation, use fertilizer and use crop protection measures.
hints: Consider integrated approach to farming
Evaluate all factors: seeds, irrigation, fertilizers, protection

questions.question_text: Why should preventive measures and biological control methods be preferred for protecting crops?
hints: Consider environmental impact of chemicals
Think about sustainability and long-term soil health

questions.question_text: What factors may be responsible for losses of grains during storage?
hints: Consider biotic factors: insects, rodents, fungi
Consider abiotic factors: moisture, temperature

questions.question_text: Which method is commonly used for improving cattle breeds and why?
hints: Think about cross-breeding techniques
Consider combining desirable traits from different breeds

questions.question_text: Discuss the implications of the following statement: 'It is interesting to note that poultry is India's most efficient converter of low fibre food stuff (which is unfit for human consumption) into highly nutritious animal protein food.'
hints: Consider feed conversion efficiency
Think about nutritional value of poultry products

questions.question_text: What management practices are common in dairy and poultry farming?
hints: Consider housing, feeding, breeding, disease control
Compare requirements of both types of farming

questions.question_text: What are the differences between broilers and layers and in their management?
hints: Consider purpose: meat vs egg production
Think about feed requirements, housing, and care

questions.question_text: How are fish obtained?
hints: Consider capture fishing vs culture fishery
Think about marine and freshwater sources

questions.question_text: What are the advantages of composite fish culture?
hints: Consider efficient use of pond resources
Think about reduced competition between species

questions.question_text: What are the desirable characters of bee varieties suitable for honey production?
hints: Consider honey collection capacity, sting behavior, breeding
Think about adaptability and maintenance requirements

questions.question_text: What is pasturage and how is it related to honey production?
hints: Define pasturage as availability of flowers
Consider how flower type affects honey quality and quantity

questions.question_text: Explain any one method of crop production which ensures high yield.
hints: Consider crop rotation, inter-cropping, or use of hybrid varieties
Explain how the method increases productivity

questions.question_text: Why are manure and fertilizers used in fields?
hints: Consider nutrient supply to plants
Think about soil fertility and crop growth

questions.question_text: What are the advantages of inter-cropping and crop rotation?
hints: Consider soil fertility maintenance, pest control, risk reduction
Compare both methods

questions.question_text: What is genetic manipulation? How is it useful in agricultural practices?
hints: Define genetic manipulation techniques
Consider development of resistant varieties and higher yields

questions.question_text: How do storage grain losses occur?
hints: Consider biotic factors: insects, rodents, microorganisms
Consider abiotic factors: moisture, temperature, humidity

questions.question_text: How do good animal husbandry practices benefit farmers?
hints: Consider increased production, disease prevention, better quality products
Think about economic benefits

questions.question_text: What are the benefits of cattle farming?
hints: Consider milk production, draught power, manure
Think about multiple products and by-products

questions.question_text: For increasing production, what is common in poultry, fisheries and bee-keeping?
hints: Consider cross-breeding, proper management, disease control
Think about quality feed and suitable environment

questions.question_text: How do you differentiate between capture fishing, mariculture and aquaculture?
hints: Define each term based on source and method
Consider natural vs cultured systems, marine vs freshwater
